Authors: Sutia S., Fahlevi M., Saparudin M., Irma D., Maemunah S.
Title: Should e-Payment Trust be e-Commerce Implemented as a Consumer Satisfaction Factor?
Affiliations: Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; Management Department, Binus Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sutia, S., Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, Binus Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Saparudin, M., Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; Irma, D., Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; Maemunah, S., Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Consumer trust related to payment is an essential topic in several studies of online shopping. Consumers are very concerned about security in transactions including when making cashless payments. This study uses a non-parametric test using a SmartPLS with a sample of 243 respondents. The results of this study provide information that E-payment trust is an important factor for consumer satisfaction in E-commerce in Indonesia. Trust related to payments is closely linked to information security and data privacy security of consumers when making transactions on E-commerce. © The Authors, published by EDP Sciences, 2020.
Author Keywords: Consumer Satisfaction; E-Commerce; E-Payment; Trust
Index Keywords: Data privacy; Information systems; Information use; Consumer satisfactions; E-payments; Indonesia; Non-parametric test; Online shopping; Electronic money

Authors: Fahlevi M., Rita, Siti Rabiah A., Aristianto Pradipta I., Marta A., Dipo F.
Title: Tourism and Absorption of the Labor Force in Indonesia: A Strategy for Development
Affiliations: Management Department, Binus Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Management Department, Binus Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Management Department, Brawijaya University, Malang, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Fahlevi, M., Management Department, Binus Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rita, Management Department, Binus Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Siti Rabiah, A., Management Department, Binus Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Aristianto Pradipta, I., Management Department, Binus Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Marta, A., Management Department, Brawijaya University, Malang, Indonesia; Dipo, F., Management Department, Brawijaya University, Malang, Indonesia
Abstract: The poor quality of labor causes low productivity and competitiveness. The objective of this study was to mediate the effect of labor absorption on economic growth in the tourism area of Lombok island. This study used the total population of the Lombok island community in three popular destinations to date among others are Senggigi Beach, Kuta Beach Lombok, and Gili Trawangan Beach with a total of 275.267 respondents. This study used random sampling because the total population is more than 100 respondents. The result found that direct or indirect effects in mediating labor absorption towards economic growth in the tourism area of Lombok island are great. Other results showed a strong indicator in each variable that affects labor absorption towards economic growth in the tourism area of Lombok island namely having the skills and fair business competition © The Authors, published by EDP Sciences, 2020.
Author Keywords: Development; Economic Growth; Labor Absorption; Tourism

Authors: Juhandi N., Zuhri S., Fahlevi M., Noviantoro R., Nur Abdi M., Setiadi
Title: Information Technology and Corporate Governance in Fraud Prevention
Affiliations: Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; Management Department, Binus Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Accounting Department, Dehasen University, Bengkulu, Indonesia; Finance Department, Muhammadiyah Makassar University, Makassar, Indonesia; Accounting Department, Dirgantara Marsekal Suryadarma University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Juhandi, N., Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; Zuhri, S., Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, Binus Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Noviantoro, R., Accounting Department, Dehasen University, Bengkulu, Indonesia; Nur Abdi, M., Finance Department, Muhammadiyah Makassar University, Makassar, Indonesia; Setiadi, Accounting Department, Dirgantara Marsekal Suryadarma University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Information technology is a technology for obtaining, processing, storing and distributing various types of information files by utilizing computers and telecommunications born of strong drives to create new innovations and creativity that can overcome all laziness and slowness of human performance. The recent phenomenon of several large companies listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange shows that there is an improper management of the company, especially in supervision, thereby reducing the value of the company. The result is proven that developed companies, especially in developed countries, use supervision not only as a leader but also technology that can automatically detect fraud and is useful as a step to prevent fraud in companies. Corporate governance is still lacking in Indonesia and other developing countries, making the level of supervision at the company does not run optimally so that the potential for fraud is still quite large. This research contributes to fill the void level of supervision in companies in Indonesia that are still experiencing fraud, so the solution in supervision is to maximize the role of information technology in companies in Indonesia. © The Authors, published by EDP Sciences, 2020.
Author Keywords: Corporate Governance; Fraud; Indonesia; Information; Technology
Index Keywords: Developing countries; Industrial management; Information systems; Information use; Corporate governance; Developed countries; Fraud prevention; Human performance; Indonesia; Information files; Large companies; Stock exchange; Crime

Title: Democratic, authocratic, bureaucratic and charismatic leadership style: which influence school teachers performance in education 4.0 era?
Affiliations: Universitas Negeri Jakarta, Indonesia; IAIN Metro Lampung, Indonesia; STIE Mahardhika Surabaya, Indonesia; IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Teknologi Wastukancana, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Agama Islam Khozinatul Ulum Blora, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Ilmu Kesehatan Tarumanagara, Indonesia

Abstract: This study aims to analyze the influence of democratic, authocratic, bureaucratic and charismatic leadership styles on the performance of elementary school teachers. The method used in this research is quantitative method. Data collection was carried out by distributing an electronic questionnaire online to 252 elementary school teachers in Jakarta. The online electronic questionnaires were distributed using simple random sampling technique. The conclusion of this study is that democratic leadership style has a positive and significant effect on teachers performance, autocratic leadership style has a positive and significant effect on teachers performance, bureaucratic leadership style and charismatic leadership style has a positive and significant effect on teachers performance. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Authocratic; Bureaucratic; Charismatic leadership style; Democratic; Performance of elementary school teachers

Authors: Kadiyono A.L., Sulistiobudi R.A., Haris I., Wahab M.K.A., Ramdani I., Purwanto A., Mufid A., Muqtada M.R., Gufron M., Nuryansah M., Ficayuma L.A., Fahlevi M., Sumartiningsih S.
Title: Develop leadership style model for indonesian teachers performance in education 4.0 era
Affiliations: Fakultas Psikologi Universitas Padjadjaran, Indonesia; Universitas Negeri Gorontalo, Indonesia; Pusat Pengajian Ilmu Kemanusiaan, University Sains Malaysia, Malaysia; UIN Sunan Kalijaga Yogyakarta, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Agama Islam Khozinatul Ulum Blora, Indonesia; IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; Al Hikmah Teacher Institute Surabaya, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Ilmu Kesehatan Tarumanagara, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kadiyono, A.L., Fakultas Psikologi Universitas Padjadjaran, Indonesia; Sulistiobudi, R.A., Fakultas Psikologi Universitas Padjadjaran, Indonesia; Haris, I., Universitas Negeri Gorontalo, Indonesia; Wahab, M.K.A., Pusat Pengajian Ilmu Kemanusiaan, University Sains Malaysia, Malaysia; Ramdani, I., UIN Sunan Kalijaga Yogyakarta, Indonesia; Purwanto, A., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Mufid, A., Sekolah Tinggi Agama Islam Khozinatul Ulum Blora, Indonesia; Muqtada, M.R., IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; Gufron, M., IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; Nuryansah, M., IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; Ficayuma, L.A., Al Hikmah Teacher Institute Surabaya, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Sumartiningsih, S., Sekolah Tinggi Ilmu Kesehatan Tarumanagara, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to analyze the effect of transformational leadership styles. Transactional, democratic, authocratic, bureaucratic and charismatic on the performance of primary school teachers in education 4.0 era. The method used in this research is quantitative method. Data collection was carried out by distributing an electronic questionnaire online to all 222 elementary school teachers in Jakarta. Online electronic questionnaires were distributed using simple random sampling technique. Software for data processing is PLS and uses SmartPLS version 3.0. The result of this study are transactional leadership, transformational, democratic leadership, autocratic leadership, bureaucratic leadership and charismatic leadership style has a positive and significant effect on teacher's performance. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Authocratic; Bureaucratic; Charismatic; Democratic; Performance of primary school teachers; Transformational leadership style. transactional
Index Keywords: article; human; human experiment; leadership; primary school; quantitative analysis; questionnaire; software; teacher

Authors: Supriadi O., Musthan Z., Sa'odah, Nurjehan R., Haryanti Y.D., Rafid Marwal M., Purwanto A., Mufid A., Yulianto R.A., Farhan M., Fitri A.A., Fahlevi M., Sumartiningsih S.
Title: Did transformational, transactional leadership style and organizational learning influence innovation capabilities of school teachers during covid-19 pandemic?
Affiliations: Universitas Singaperbangsa Karawang, Indonesia; Institut Agama Islam Negeri (IAIN) Kendari, Indonesia; Universitas MuhammadiyahTangerang, Indonesia; SD Negeri, Gebang, 050763, Indonesia; Universitas Majalengka, Indonesia; IAI Al-Amana Jeneponto Sulawesi Selatan, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Agama Islam Khozinatul Ulum Blora, Indonesia; Universitas Islam As-Syafiiyah Jakarta, Indonesia; Universitas Islam Sultan Agung, Indonesia; Islamic Institute of AL-AZIS Indramayu, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Ilmu Kesehatan Tarumanagara, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Supriadi, O., Universitas Singaperbangsa Karawang, Indonesia; Musthan, Z., Institut Agama Islam Negeri (IAIN) Kendari, Indonesia; Sa'odah, Universitas MuhammadiyahTangerang, Indonesia; Nurjehan, R., SD Negeri, Gebang, 050763, Indonesia; Haryanti, Y.D., Universitas Majalengka, Indonesia; Rafid Marwal, M., IAI Al-Amana Jeneponto Sulawesi Selatan, Indonesia; Purwanto, A., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Mufid, A., Sekolah Tinggi Agama Islam Khozinatul Ulum Blora, Indonesia; Yulianto, R.A., Universitas Islam As-Syafiiyah Jakarta, Indonesia; Farhan, M., Universitas Islam Sultan Agung, Indonesia; Fitri, A.A., Islamic Institute of AL-AZIS Indramayu, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Sumartiningsih, S., Sekolah Tinggi Ilmu Kesehatan Tarumanagara, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to analyze and calculate the influence of transformational, transactional leadership and organizational learning on the innovation capabilities of teachers in Islamic schools in Jakarta during the COVID-19 pandemic. This research uses quantitative methods and data collection was carried out by simple random sampling electronically using an online questionnaire to the population of teachers in Islamic schools in Jakarta at the COVID-19 pandemic. The results of the questionnaire were returned and valid as many as 140 respondents. Data processing using SEM method with SmartPLS 3.0 software. The results of this study indicate that transformational leadership has a positive and significant effect on the innovation capabilities of teachers. Transactional leadership has a positive and significant effect on teachers' innovation abilities. The learning organization has a positive and significant effect on the innovation ability of teachers. Novelty of this new research proposes a model for building innovation capabilities among teachers through transformational and transactional leadership and organizational learning. This research can be used as a reference for future research and can be applied in other places. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Leadership. school teachers; Organizational learning; Teacher innovation capability
Index Keywords: aptitude; Article; convergent validity; coronavirus disease 2019; human; information processing; leadership; organization; pandemic; priority journal; professional competence; quantitative analysis; questionnaire; reliability; school teacher; software

Authors: Zuniawan A., Wirawati S.M., Saefulah, Fahlevi M., Purwanto A., Vizano N.A., Pramono R.
Title: Did Seiri Seiton Seiso Seiketsu and Shitsuke affected medical health industry business performance?
Source title: European Journal of Molecular and Clinical Medicine
Affiliations: Universitas Mercu Buana, Indonesia; Universitas Banten Jaya, Indonesia; Universitas Mercu Buana, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Universitas Mercu Buana, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Zuniawan, A., Universitas Mercu Buana, Indonesia; Wirawati, S.M., Universitas Banten Jaya, Indonesia; Saefulah, Universitas Mercu Buana, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Purwanto, A., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Vizano, N.A., Universitas Mercu Buana, Indonesia; Pramono, R., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia
Abstract: This research purpose to analyze the effect of implementation of 5S (Seiri, Seiton, Seiso, Seiketsu, and Shitsuke) to business performance in the medical health industry industries. This research uses a quantitative approach with Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) using smart PLS software. Data collection methods using online questionnaires and snowball sampling technique, the number of respondents to be used are 240 respondents of medical health industry managers in Indonesia . The results of this research conclude that Seiri has a positive and significant effect on the business performance, Seiton has a positive and significant effect on the business performance, Seiso has a positive and significant effect on the business performance, Seiketsu has a positive and significant effect on the business performance, Shitsuke has a positive and significant effect on the business performance. This novelty of this research is build a new model of the effect of applying Seiri, Seiton, Seiso, Seiketsu, and Shitsuke to the medical health industry industries in Indonesia. © 2020 Ubiquity Press. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Business performance; Seiketsu and shitsuke; Seiri; Seiso; Seiton
Index Keywords: adult; article; female; human; human experiment; Indonesia; major clinical study; male; manager; quantitative analysis; questionnaire; software; structural equation modeling

Authors: Sutia S., Riadi R., Fahlevi M., Istan M., Juhara S., Pramono R., Purwanto A., Purba J.T., Munthe A.P., Juliana
Title: Benefit of benchmarking methods in several industries: A systematic literature review
Affiliations: Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; State Islamic Insitute of Curup, Indonesia; Universitas Islam Syekh Yusuf, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sutia, S., Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; Riadi, R., Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Istan, M., State Islamic Insitute of Curup, Indonesia; Juhara, S., Universitas Islam Syekh Yusuf, Indonesia; Pramono, R., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Purwanto, A., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Purba, J.T., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Munthe, A.P., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Juliana, Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia
Abstract: The aim of this paper is to determine the benefits of benchmarking methods in the industry, the benefits of implementing benchmarking to customer satisfaction, increased productivity, quality improvement, continuous improvement, market performance, environmental awareness and industry competitiveness. The method used in this research is literature review, data collection and originating information from reputable international journals on benchmarking in the industry, there are 42 of international journals articles collected and as a source of data analysis review.The data in this paper is secondary data sources referred to several articles from reputable international journals. The results of the literature review are found that benchmarking in industrial companies provides benefits that are increased customer satisfaction, increased productivity, increased quality, the implementation of continuous improvement, increased market performance, increased environmental awareness and increased industrial competitiveness. This research can be used as a new reference for researchers to conduct further research and provide the benefit of adding literacy to other researchers who will examine the topic of benchmarking in the industry. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Bechmarking; Manufacturing Industries; Schematic Literature Review

Authors: Noviantoro R., Maskuroh N., Santoso B., Abdi M.N., Fahlevi M., Pramono R., Purwanto A., Purba J.T., Munthe A.P., Juliana
Title: Did quality management system ISO 9001 version 2015 influence business performance? Evidence from Indonesian hospitals
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Dehasen University, Indonesia; Sharia Economic Department, Sultan Maulana Hasanuddin Islamic University, Indonesia; Accounting Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Indonesia; Finance Department, Muhammadiyah Makassar University, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Noviantoro, R., Accounting Department, Dehasen University, Indonesia; Maskuroh, N., Sharia Economic Department, Sultan Maulana Hasanuddin Islamic University, Indonesia; Santoso, B., Accounting Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Indonesia; Abdi, M.N., Finance Department, Muhammadiyah Makassar University, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Pramono, R., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Purwanto, A., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Purba, J.T., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Munthe, A.P., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Juliana, Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to analyze the effect of implementing the ISO 9001: 2015 Quality Management System on the performance of hospitals in Indonesia. This research method is quantitative, data collection through online questionnaires conducted by simple random sampling technique and respondents are managers as many as 180 people from 15 hospitals that have implemented the ISO 9001: 2015 quality management system for 5 years in Indonesia. Data processing using SEM method with SmartPLS 3.0 software. The results of this study concluded that customer focus ISO has a positive and significant effect on hospital performance, Leadership principle has a positive and significant effect on hospital performance, People Engagement has a positive and significant effect on hospital performance, process approach has a positive and significant effect on hospital performance, improvement principle has a positive and significant effect on hospital performance, evidence-based decision making has a positive and significant effect on hospital performance, relationship management has a positive effect and significant to hospital performance. The novelty of this research is a new model of the effect of implementing on hospital performance. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Hospitals Performance; ISO 9001: 2015; Quality Management System

Authors: Purwanto A., Wirawati S.M., Arthawati S.N., Radyawanto A.S., Rusdianto B., Haris M., Kartika H., Rabathi S.R., Fahlevi M., Abidin R.Z., Yunanto D.A.
Title: Lean six sigma model for pharmacy manufacturing: Yesterday, today and tomorrow
Affiliations: Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Universitas Mercu Buana, Indonesia; Universitas Banten Jaya, Indonesia; Universitas Sultan Ageng Tirtayasa, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Purwanto, A., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Wirawati, S.M., Universitas Banten Jaya, Indonesia; Arthawati, S.N., Universitas Sultan Ageng Tirtayasa, Indonesia; Radyawanto, A.S., Universitas Mercu Buana, Indonesia; Rusdianto, B., Universitas Mercu Buana, Indonesia; Haris, M., Universitas Mercu Buana, Indonesia; Kartika, H., Universitas Mercu Buana, Indonesia; Rabathi, S.R., Universitas Sultan Ageng Tirtayasa, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Abidin, R.Z., Universitas Mercu Buana, Indonesia; Yunanto, D.A., Universitas Mercu Buana, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to create a model and analyze the effect of the application of Six Sigma on the performance of the pharmaceutical industry, the application of the six sigma model through DMIC, namely Determine, Measure, Improve and Control.The method used in this research is quantitative method. Data collection is by circulating electronic questionnaires online to the pharmacy management industry. The instrument used to measure Six Sigma is DMIC, namely Determine, Measure, Improve and Control. Respondents in this research were 300 managers from 15 industries pharmacy which has implemented Six Sigma for 5 years. Based on the results of this study, it is concluded that the application of six sigma has a significant effect on the performance of the pharmaceutical industry. The application of six sigma through the DMIC steps, namely determine, measure, improve and control will encourage increased performance of the pharmacy industry. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Company Performance; DMIC; Pharmacy Industries; Six Sigma
Index Keywords: adult; article; drug industry; female; human; human experiment; male; manager; quantitative analysis; questionnaire

Authors: Supriyadi D., Syafitri L.N.H., Widodo S.F.A., Wahidi R., Arinta Y.N., Nabhan F., Mufid A., Purwanto A., Fahlevi M., Sunarsi D., Cahyono Y.
Title: Innovation and authentic leadership of islamic university lectures in faculty pharmacy faculty: What is the role of psychological capital?
Affiliations: STIA Menara Siswa, Indonesia; Universitas Mercu Buana Yogyakarta, Indonesia; Universitas Negeri Yogyakarta, Indonesia; Universitas Islam Indragiri (UNISI), Indonesia; IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Agama Islam Khozinatul, Ulum Blora, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Universitas Pamulang, Indonesia; Universitas Pramita, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Supriyadi, D., STIA Menara Siswa, Indonesia; Syafitri, L.N.H., Universitas Mercu Buana Yogyakarta, Indonesia; Widodo, S.F.A., Universitas Negeri Yogyakarta, Indonesia; Wahidi, R., Universitas Islam Indragiri (UNISI), Indonesia; Arinta, Y.N., IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; Nabhan, F., IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; Mufid, A., Sekolah Tinggi Agama Islam Khozinatul, Ulum Blora, Indonesia; Purwanto, A., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Sunarsi, D., Universitas Pamulang, Indonesia; Cahyono, Y., Universitas Pramita, Indonesia
Abstract: This research aims to measure the effect of authentic leadership style and psychological capital on the innovative work behavior of a Lectures in pharmacy faculty. Psychological capital also plays a role as a mediation between the relationship between authentic leadership and innovative work behavior. Data collection was carried out by simple random sampling and the returned and valid questionnaire results were 120 respondents. Data processing was using the SEM method with SmartPLS 3.0 software. The results of this research are authentic leadership style and psychological capital have a positive and significant effect on innovative work behavior. Psychological capital as a mediator for the relationship between authentic leadership style and innovative work behavior. This novel research is proposing a model to enhance innovative work behavior among lectures of Islamic Universities in Indonesia through authentic leadership practice and psychological capital. This research can pave the way to improve lectures readiness in facing global business competition. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Authentic leadership; Innovative work behavior; Psychological capital
Index Keywords: adult; article; competition; female; human; human experiment; Indonesia; leadership; major clinical study; male; pharmacy school; questionnaire; software

Authors: Suryaman M., Cahyono Y., Muliansyah D., Bustani O., Suryani P., Fahlevi M., Pramono R., Purwanto A., Purba J.T., Munthe A.P., Juliana, Harimurti S.M.
Title: COVID-19 pandemic and home online learning system: Does it affect the quality of pharmacy school learning?
Affiliations: Universitas Singaperbangsa, Karawang, Indonesia; Universitas Pramita Indonesia, Indonesia; STIE Indonesia School of Management, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Ilmu Ekonomi Ppi, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Universitas Islam Indonesia, Indonesia

Abstract: The purpose of this study is to identify and obtain information about the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on the learning process. This research uses the literature study method which is an analysis that aims to describe the main content based on the collection of information obtained. The information in question originates from various scientific articles related to the implementation of online learning during the COVID-19 pandemic. The scientific articles in question are articles obtained from reputable national journals and international journals indexed by Scopus. The data and information that have been obtained are then collected, analyzed, and concluded so as to get a recommendation as a literature study. Conclusion The results of this study are that there are several obstacles experienced by students, teachers and parents in online teaching and learning activities, namely mastery of technology is still lacking, additional internet quota costs, additional work for parents in assisting children in learning, communication and socialization between students., teachers and parents are reduced and working hours are unlimited for teachers because they have to communicate and coordinate with parents, other teachers, and school principals. The COVID-19 pandemic affects many things including educational life, parents of students, students and the learning process, as a teacher who has the responsibility to educate students cannot stop. Teachers must find appropriate ways to promote the learning process academically and socio emotional. Teachers must be able to manage classrooms in classrooms and online classes. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Learning Process; Online Learning; Pandemic Covid-19

Title: Islamic leadership model for Indonesian millennial teachers performance in pharmacy schools
Affiliations: Institut Ilmu Al-Quran (IIQ), Jakarta, Indonesia; IAIN Takengon, Aceh Tengah, Indonesia; IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; Universitas Singaperbangsa, Karawang, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Agama Islam Khozinatul, Ulum Blora, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; STAI Al-Muhammad, Cepu, Indonesia; UIN Raden Intan, Lampung, Indonesia; IAIN Metro, Lampung, Indonesia

Abstract: The purpose of this research was to examine the relationship between the influence of honesty (Sidiq) on millennial performance teachers in Pharmacy Schools. The influence of trust (Amanah on millennial performance teachers. Influence (Fathonah) on performance. Communicative influence (Tablig) on millennial performance teachers. The method used in this research is quantitative method. Data collection was carried out by distributing questionnaires to millennial teachers in high schools in Jakarta. Closed questionnaires are designed except for questions / statements about the identity of the respondents in the form of a semi-open questionnaire. Respondents in this research were senior high school teachers, totaling 180 people. Questionnaires were distributed using simple random sampling technique. The results of the returned questionnaires and the valid samples were 180 questionnaires. The conclusion in this study is that Honesty (Sidiq) has a positive and significant effect on millennial teacher performance, Trust (Amanah) has a positive and significant effect on performance, Smart (Fathonah) has a positive and significant effect on millennial teacher performance, Communicative (Tablig) has a positive and significant effect. on the performance of millennial teachers. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.

Authors: Fahlevi M.
Title: Mobile applications for health management in Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Fahlevi, M., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Health is the most important thing in life, if someone is stricken with a disease then that person cannot perform activities optimally. Likewise, with employees in the company many losses will be experienced because it cannot work optimally. Then in an age that is as sophisticated as it is today, the submission of medical check-up results is still using the conventional method, which is printed on sheets of paper. The risk of these results can be lost or damaged becomes even greater, given the data is very important. Health Management is a website-based application that was formed with the aim to assist companies in managing the health of their employees and assist in ordering employee's annual medical check-up. The results of this study are Health Mobile application has been running smoothly, this can be seen from the results of the black box testing done. Health applications can provide healthy lifestyle advice and record health activities that have been carried out. Health applications can help users save health data and simplify the process reimbursement of health funds. Display health applications are comfortable to see and easily understood by users. © 2020 IEEE.

Authors: Adila T.M., Bintang W.S., Ikhsan R.B., Fahlevi M.
Title: Instagram as information in developing purchase intentions: The role of social E-wom and brand attitude
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adila, T.M., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bintang, W.S., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ikhsan, R.B., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Instagram is one of many social media that companies use to introduce their brands, and e-commerce is a place where sellers and buyers meet, and they can make an online transaction. The purpose of this study was to determine the effect of social e-WOM on brand attitude and its impact on purchase intention on e-commerce in the JABODETABEK region (Jakarta, Bogor, Depok, Tangerang, Bekasi). According to the type of data and analysis techniques that will be used, this study is a quantitative study. The research method was conducted by distributing questionnaires by an Instagram user who stays in JABODETABEK with 300 respondents. Data collected and processed using SEM LISREL. The result reached is that social e-WOM greatly influences brand attitude and has an impact on purchasing intentions. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Brand attitude; E-wom; Instagram; Purchase intention
Index Keywords: Electronic commerce; Information management; Purchasing; Surveys; Analysis techniques; Jakarta; Online transaction; Purchase intention; Quantitative study; research methods; Social media; Sales

Authors: Suwarni, Noviantoro R., Fahlevi M., Abdi M.N.
Title: Startup valuation by venture capitalists: An empirical study Indonesia firms
Source title: International Journal of Control and Automation
Affiliations: Department of Economic Science, Dehasen Bengkulu University, India; Department of Accounting, Dehasen Bengkulu University, India; Department of Management, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, India; Department of Management, Muhammadiyah Makassar University, India
Authors with affiliations: Suwarni, Department of Economic Science, Dehasen Bengkulu University, India; Noviantoro, R., Department of Accounting, Dehasen Bengkulu University, India; Fahlevi, M., Department of Management, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, India; Abdi, M.N., Department of Management, Muhammadiyah Makassar University, India
Abstract: Indonesia currently has four Unicorns companies that have reached $1 billion without entering into the stock market. These companies include: Go-jek, Traveloka, and market centers such as Bukalapak and Tokopedia. Indonesia is very likely to see more unicorns in the following years, with the most promising sectors such as: Transportation, education, healthcare, and fintech. However, with the Indonesian landscape constantly changing, companies and investors need to keep updating themselves to stay competitive and to seize opportunities at the right time. Startup in Indonesia began to develop and became one of the government programs to continue to develop startups, there are a number of startups in Indonesia that have become unicorn status that greatly influence the current Indonesian economy. Startup helped foster economic growth and growth in Indonesia, capital and business model problems were the main problems for new startups in the early days to start their business. This research proved the previous research conducted by Adamo Jr. (2014 and Reis (2010) that there are several levels in the startup and its function towards the economy of a country, startups can be a pillar of the economy, especially in developing country economies that need good growth. © 2020 SERSC.
Author Keywords: Digital; E-Commerce; Indonesia; Investment; Startup
Funding Text 1: The 1000 Startup Digital National Movement is a movement to realize Indonesia's potential to become The Digital Energy of Asia in 2020 by printing 1000 startups that are the solution to various problems by utilizing digital technology. This movement was initiated by KIBAR and supported by the Ministry of Communication and Information of the Republic of Indonesia. KIBAR is a company that aims to build a technological ecosystem in Indonesia through capacity building, mentoring and incubation initiatives in various cities.

Authors: Sutia S., Riadi R., Fahlevi M.
Title: The influence of supply chain performance and motivation on employee performance
Source title: International Journal of Supply Chain Management
Affiliations: Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, 13770, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sutia, S., Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, 13770, Indonesia; Riadi, R., Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Jakarta, 13770, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Good performance will support the achievement of supply chain management goals and enhance the competitiveness of the company. There are many factors that affect employee performance improvement, including supply chain management and employee motivation. This study wants to prove the influence of supply chain management and motivation on employee performance. Research conducted at PT. Bank Bukopin with 119 respondents as a sample. There is no influence between motivation on employee performance, simultaneously, there is influence between supply chain management and motivation to employee performance. © ExcelingTech Pub, UK.
Author Keywords: Employee performance; Motivation; Supply chain management

Authors: Purwanto A., Supono J., Rahayu P., Ponda H., Fatma N.F., Fahlevi M.
Title: Develop risk and assesment procedure for anticipating covid-19 in food industries
Affiliations: Pelita Harapan University, Tangerang, Indonesia; Universitas Mercu Buana, Tangerang, Indonesia; Universitas Muhammadiyah Tangerang, Tangerang, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Purwanto, A., Pelita Harapan University, Tangerang, Indonesia; Supono, J., Universitas Mercu Buana, Tangerang, Indonesia; Rahayu, P., Universitas Muhammadiyah Tangerang, Tangerang, Indonesia; Ponda, H., Universitas Muhammadiyah Tangerang, Tangerang, Indonesia; Fatma, N.F., Universitas Muhammadiyah Tangerang, Tangerang, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to develop risk and assesment procedure for anticipating Covid-19 in food industries. Research using the case study qualitative approach. In this study, selected participant were 10 people of top management of 10 food industries. For confidentiality purposes, respondents are given the initials P1, P2, P3, P4, P5, P6, P6, P7, P8, P9 and P10. Semi- structured interviews were conducted and a list of questions compiled for interviews was developed based on the related literature. The results of this study are that there are Risk and Assesment Procedure for Anticipating Covid-19 in food industries such as procedure for factory response team, procedure for factory shutdown,procedure for cleaning the factory, procedure for prepare the reset factory, procedure for covid-19 checklist before restart, procedure for worker risk factor, procedure for site visitor, procedure for site employees and regular contractors transportation mode entrance, procedure for employees and regular contractors, procedure for employees additional checking working hours, procedure for truck driver screening, procedure for change room, procedure for office meeting, procedure for personal protection equipment, procedure for zoning & social distancing, procedure for canteen, procedure for site office cleaning, procedure for shop floor activities for shift change, procedure for shop floor activities for routin activities after.procedure for quality lab, procedure for machine sanitization and disinfection. procedure for machine cleaning and disinfection, procedure for rest room, procedure for smoking area, procedure for forklift, procedure for warehouse activities, procedure for masks, sanitization, and cleaning equipment, procedure for thermometers and additional equipment for control, procedure for occupational health & safety and process safety, procedure for workplace controls examples during a COVID-19 outbreak. © 2020 Innovare Academics Sciences Pvt. Ltd. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: COVID-19; Explorative Study; Food Industries; Risk and Assesment

Authors: Desky H., Mukhtasar, Istan M., Ariesa Y., Dewi I.B.M., Fahlevi M., Abdi M.N., Noviantoro R., Purwanto A.
Title: Did trilogy leadership style, organizational citizenship behaviour (OCB) and organizational commitment (OCO) influence financial performance? Evidence from pharmacy industries
Affiliations: Faculty of Economics and Islamic Business, IAIN Lhokseumawe, Indonesia; Faculty of Sharia and Islamic Economics, State Islamic Institute of Curup, Indonesia; Faculty of Economics, Prima Indonesia University, Indonesia; Faculty of Communication, Persiaran Multimedia, Malaysia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Management Department, Muhammadiyah Makassar University, Indonesia; Accounting Departement, Faculty of Economics, Dehasen Bengkulu University, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Desky, H., Faculty of Economics and Islamic Business, IAIN Lhokseumawe, Indonesia; Mukhtasar, Faculty of Economics and Islamic Business, IAIN Lhokseumawe, Indonesia; Istan, M., Faculty of Sharia and Islamic Economics, State Islamic Institute of Curup, Indonesia; Ariesa, Y., Faculty of Economics, Prima Indonesia University, Indonesia; Dewi, I.B.M., Faculty of Communication, Persiaran Multimedia, Malaysia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Abdi, M.N., Management Department, Muhammadiyah Makassar University, Indonesia; Noviantoro, R., Accounting Departement, Faculty of Economics, Dehasen Bengkulu University, Indonesia; Purwanto, A., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to identify and analyze the trilogy of leadership on financial performance, to identify and analyze OCB on financial performance and to identify and analyze organizational commitment to financial performance. The method used in this research is quantitative method. Data collection by distributing questionnaires to 150 financial managers in the pharmaceutical industry. Electronic questionnaires are distributed online using simple random sampling technique. The method for processing and analyzing data is by using PLS and using SmartPLS version 3.0 software. Leadership Trilogy style have positive and significant effect on Financial Performance, Organizational Citizenship Behaviour (OCB) have positive and significant effect on Financial Performance, Organizational Commitment (OCO) have positive and significant effect on Financial Performance. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Financial performance; Organizational citizenship behaviour; Organizational commitment; Pharmacy industries; Trilogy leadership style

Authors: Purwanto A., Fahlevi M., Maharani S., Muharom F., Suryanto, Setyaningsih W., Faidi A., Azhar A., Pramono R., Bernarto I.
Title: Indonesian doctoral students article publication barriers in international high impact journals: A mixed methods research
Affiliations: Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; IAIN, Surakarta, Indonesia; PP. Edi Mancoro, Semarang, Indonesia; STAI Syarif Muhammad Raha, Indonesia; Universitas Pramita Indonesia, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Purwanto, A., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Maharani, S., IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; Muharom, F., IAIN, Surakarta, Indonesia; Suryanto, IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; Setyaningsih, W., IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; Faidi, A., PP. Edi Mancoro, Semarang, Indonesia; Azhar, A., STAI Syarif Muhammad Raha, Indonesia; Pramono, R., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Bernarto, I., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia, Universitas Pramita Indonesia, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper is an exploratory sequential mixed methods research aimed to explore the inhibiting factors of Indonesian doctoral students in conducting high impact international publications with qualitative exploratory methods and knowing the relationship between inhibiting factors with the performance of publications with quantitative methods. This research uses exploratory sequential mixed methods, the first stage is a qualitative analysis exploring factors inhibiting the publication of doctoral students. Primary data collection using in-depth interviews with 7 (seven) doctoral program students who were selected and determined using purposive sampling method. The next step is to conduct a quantitative analysis to get the correlation between the inhibiting factors and the performance of the publication. Collecting primary data using an online questionnaire with 110 respondents who were selected using the snowball sampling method and then analyzed using the LISRELL program. The results of this research indicate that doctoral student respondents have had several constraints to publishing in journals international reputation such as negative result reviewer, lack of Funding, long respon time, low english skill, lack of writing time, limiting writing skill, limiting submision skill, high publication fee, inadequate facilities, limited journals reference, limited technology skill. Novelty of this research is the first research of the obstacles in the publication of doctoral students in Indonesia with the Exploratory Sequential Mixed Methods method with the scope of the territory of a country. This research can be a reference for similar research, and subsequent research can be conducted in other countries. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.

Title: Effect of ISO 9001, ISO 45001 and ISO 14000 toward financial performance of Indonesian manufacturing
Affiliations: UIN Sultan Maulana Hasanuddin, Banten, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Faculty of Economics, Tama Jagakarsa University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Politeknik Energi dan Mineral Akamigas (PEM Akamigas), Cepu, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Universitas Muhammadiyah Tangerang, Indonesia; STIE Mahardhika, Surabaya, Indonesia; Management Department, Kusuma Negara Business School, Indonesia; Politeknik Penerbangan Indonesia Curug, Indonesia; Universitas Pramita Indonesia, Indonesia

Abstract: The purpose of this study was to analyze the influence of ISO 9001 quality management system, ISO 45001 safety management system and ISO 14001 on financia performance of manufacturing industries. This research method is a quantitative method with data processing tools using the SmartPLS version 3.0 program. The research data were obtained from an online electronic questionnaire distributed online using a snowball sampling system. The respondents of this study were 220 finace manager of manufacturing comoany. The results of data analysis show that ISO 9001, ISO 45001 and ISO 14001 influence financial performance performance. The novelty of this study is the first ISO 9001, ISO 45001 and ISO 14001 research model with on Financial performance. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.

Authors: Sunarsi D., Rohaeni N., Wulansari R., Andriani J., Muslimat A., Rialmi Z., Kustini E., Kristianti L.S., Rostikawati D., Effendy A.A., Purwanto A., Fahlevi M.
Title: Effect of e-leadership style, organizational commitment and service quality towards indonesian school performance
Affiliations: Universitas Pamulang, Pamulang, Indonesia; Universitas Pasundan, Pasundan, Indonesia; Universitas Bina Bangsa, Bina Bangsa, Indonesia; Universitas Serang Raya, Serang Raya, Indonesia; Universiti Pendidikan Sultan Idris, Malaysia; Universitas Pembangunan Nasional Veteran Jakarta, Jakarta, Indonesia; Universitas Pakuan, Jawa Barat, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia

Abstract: The purpose of this study was to analyze the influence of e-leadership, organizational commitment and service quality toward school performance. This research method is a quantitative method with data processing tools using the SmartPLS version 3.0 program. The research data were obtained from an online electronic questionnaire distributed online using a snowball sampling system. The respondents of this study were 200 teachers at school in Banten. The results of data analysis show e-leadership, organizational commitment and service quality significantly influence school performance. The novelty of this study is the first leadership research model with e-leadership, organizational commitment and service quality variables on school performance. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.

Authors: Indrawan I., Evanirosa, Ali R., Indra, Ramadan, Hanif M., Harun I., Hanum L., Purwanto A., Mufid A., Nurkayati S., Fahlevi M., Sumartiningsih S.
Title: Develop model of transactional, transformational, democratic and authocratic leadership style for indonesian school performance in education 4.0 era
Affiliations: Universitas Islam Indragiri Tembilahan INHIL, Riau, Indonesia; IAIN Takengon Aceh Tengah, Tengah, Indonesia; IAIN Purwokerto, Purwokerto, Indonesia; IAIN Langsa, Langsa, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Agama Islam Khozinatul Ulum Blora, Blora, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Ilmu Kesehatan Tarumanagara, Indonesia

Abstract: This study aims to analyze the influence of transactional, transformational, democratic and authocratic leadership styles on the performance of elementary school teachers. The method used in this research is quantitative method. Data collection was carried out by distributing an electronic questionnaire online to all 282 elementary school teachers in Jakarta. Online electronic questionnaires were distributed using simple random sampling technique. Software for data processing is PLS and uses SmartPLS version 3.0. The conclusion of this study is that transactional, transformational leadership, democratic leadership style and autocratic leadership style has a positive and significant effect on teacher's performance. This study provides a novelty model for primary school teacher leadership in the education 4.0 era and can be a reference for further research and can also be developed at other school levels and elsewhere. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.

Authors: Nugroho B.S., Suheri, Hakim L., Irawan B., Sholehuddin M.S., Ibrahim T., Ridlwan M., Hidayati L., Aji G., Mufid A., Ihsan N., Purwanto A., Fahlevi M.
Title: Effect of Knowledge Sharing dan Leader member Exchange (LMX) and Organizational Citizenship Behavior (OCB) to Indonesian Lectures’ Performance
Affiliations: Politeknik Energi dan Mineral Akamigas (PEM Akamigas), Cepu, Indonesia; STAI At Taqwa Bondowoso, Indonesia; UIN STS, Jambi, Indonesia; State Islamic Institute of Jember, Indonesia; IAIN Pekalongan, Indonesia; UIN Sunan Gunung Djati, Bandung, Indonesia; 8IAI Al Hikmah, Tuban, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Agama Islam Khozinatul, Ulum Blora, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Nugroho, B.S., Politeknik Energi dan Mineral Akamigas (PEM Akamigas), Cepu, Indonesia; Suheri, STAI At Taqwa Bondowoso, Indonesia; Hakim, L., UIN STS, Jambi, Indonesia; Irawan, B., State Islamic Institute of Jember, Indonesia; Sholehuddin, M.S., IAIN Pekalongan, Indonesia; Ibrahim, T., UIN Sunan Gunung Djati, Bandung, Indonesia; Ridlwan, M., 8IAI Al Hikmah, Tuban, Indonesia; Hidayati, L., 8IAI Al Hikmah, Tuban, Indonesia; Aji, G., IAIN Pekalongan, Indonesia; Mufid, A., Sekolah Tinggi Agama Islam Khozinatul, Ulum Blora, Indonesia; Ihsan, N., Sekolah Tinggi Agama Islam Khozinatul, Ulum Blora, Indonesia; Purwanto, A., Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: The goal of this study was to determine and analyse the effect that information sharing on University teachers' performance, to develop and analyse the effect of LMX on university lecturers' performance, to determine and analyse the impact of Organizational Citizen's Conduct (OCBs) on University lecturers' performance, etc. Quantitative techniques for interpretation are used in this study. Data collection took place in private Universities in Jakarta by offering electronic surveys for lectures. As data processing methods version 3.0 of SmartPLS was used. Data from 180 lectures in private universities by taking a snowball sample set. The outcome of this study is the exchange of information which has a positive and significant impact on lecture performance and the positive and significant impact on lecture performance and the actions of the OCB as a leader in membership (LMX). © The Author(s), 2020.
Author Keywords: Knowledge Sharing; Leader member Exchange (LMX); Lectures’ Performance; Organizational Citizenship Behavior (OCB)
Index Keywords: article; citizenship; human; leadership; quantitative analysis; snowball sample; teacher

Abstract: This research was designed to evaluate and analyse the impact of the OSC on high school results, to determine and analysis the effect of the work on the school's results at secondary schools, and to determine and analyse the influence of OSC on school performance in midschools. As an analysis tool, this review uses quantitative methods. Data collection has been done through the distribution of online electronic questionnaires to senior high school teachers in Jakarta. Snowball sampling data set of 150 Senior High School teachers. The results of this study show that the relationship between job satisfaction and school performance is significant, the correlation between organisation's engagement and school performance is relevant, and that the link is significant between organisational citizenship and school performance. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.

Title: Developing model of halal food purchase intention among indonesian non-muslim consumers: An explanatory sequential mixed methods research
Affiliations: Universitas Sains Al-Qur'an Jawa Tengah di Wonosobo, Indonesia; UIN Walisongo Semarang, Semarang, Indonesia; Universitas Brawijaya Malang, Malang, Indonesia; Universitas Sam Ratulangi Manado, Manado, Indonesia; Sociology of Religion Institut Agama Islam Negeri Parepare, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; State Islamic Institute of Pekalongan, Pekalongan, Indonesia; Universitas Pamulang, Pamulang, Indonesia; Universitas Pasundan, Pasundan, Indonesia; Universitas Pakuan, Pakuan, Indonesia

Abstract: This paper explores sequential, mixed methodology research aimed at examining and examining the effects on purchasing intent by non-Muslim consumers in Indonesia of halal food perception, halal food quality and halal food safety and halal food knowledges. The first step was quantitative analysis, online sampling and electronic questionnaires were randomly distributed to 340 respondents, while snowball techniques were used. The total number of questionnaire respondents was 340. Data processing and hypothesis that have been tested on the basis of the linear and structural model of structural equation (LISREL) is a qualitative analytical analysis that explores the influence that non-Muslim consumers have on the purchase of Halalal food. Data collection using in-depth interviews with 5 (fifths) non-Muslim consumers selected and determined by purposive sample method. Our analysis results showed that halal-food reception has a significant impact on the repetition of purchases. Halalal-food quality has a significant effect on buying repetitions. The result of this study could give an insight into the non-Muslim consumers in the halal food industry as one of their objectives and help to know the level of non-Muslim knowledge and perception of halal foods. Halal foods are not a product of this study. The novelty of this work is the new model of the perception of halal food, halal food quality, halal food safety and halal food in Indonesia with the explanatory sequencial mixed methods covering the area of one nation. The research is based on a new model of purchasing intentions for non-Muslim consumers in Indonesia Such research can be used as a reference for similar research, and further investigations may be carried out in other countries and adapted and carried out by others or in other regions. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.

Title: Effect of ecological, servant dan digital leadership style influence university performance? evidence from indonesian universities
Affiliations: Universitas Islam Negeri Mataram, Indonesia; Politeknik Energi dan Mineral Akamigas (PEM Akamigas), Cepu, Indonesia; UIN STS Jambi, Jambi, Indonesia; Universitas Islam Negeri Raden Intan Lampung, Lampung, Indonesia; Universitas Singaperbangsa Karawang, Karawang, Indonesia; Universitas Muhammadiyah Bandung, Bandung, Indonesia; IAIN Pekalongan, Pekalongan, Indonesia; STIT Rakeyan Santang, Santang, Indonesia; State Islamic Institute of Pekalongan, Pekalongan, Indonesia; Sekolah Tinggi Agama Islam Khozinatul Ulum Blora, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Universitas Negeri Semarang, Semarang, Indonesia

Abstract: The purpose of this study was to analyze the influence of ecology leadership, servant leadership and digital leadership toward universities performance. This research method is a quantitative method with data processing tools using the SmartPLS version 3.0 program. The research data were obtained from an online electronic questionnaire distributed online using a snowball sampling system. The respondents of this study were 222 lectures of universities in Banten. The results of data analysis show that servant leadership, digital leadership and ecological leadership significantly influence universities performance. The novelty of this study is the first leadership research model with servant, digital and ecology variables on universities performance. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.

Title: Effect of leadership style toward indonesian education performance in education 4.0 era: A schematic literature review
Affiliations: IAI Sunan Giri Ponorogo, Indonesia; Politeknik Energi dan Mineral Akamigas (PEM Akamigas) Cepu, Indonesia; UIN STS Jambi, Indonesia; MPI FTK UIN Sunan Gunung Djati Bandung, Indonesia; UIN Sunan Gunung Djati Bandung, Indonesia; Universitas Djuanda, Indonesia; UIN Syarif Hidayatullah Jakarta, Indonesia; State Islamic Institute of Pekalongan, Indonesia; IAIN Salatiga, Indonesia; Universitas Subang, Indonesia; IAIN Kudus, Indonesia; Pelita Harapan University, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Universitas Negeri Semarang, Indonesia

Abstract: The purpose of writing this article is to conduct a systematic literature review, on 6 (six) articles of leadership models from reputable international journals. The method used is a systematic literature review of 6 articles published in reputable international journals that discuss leadership models in secondary and higher education institutions in education 4.0 era. The results of the systematic literature review show that the leadership models of the 6 articles show similar similarities, namely transactional, transformational, charismatic, bureaucratic, and democratic leadership that have a positive and significant effect on the performance of educational institutions. © 2020 EManuscript Technologies. All rights reserved.

Authors: Sutia S., Adha S., Fahlevi M.
Title: Why do Customers Intend to Repurchase Transportation Online in Indonesia?
Affiliations: Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Kusuma Negara, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sutia, S., Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Kusuma Negara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Adha, S., Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Kusuma Negara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Kusuma Negara, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The rapid population growth of Jakarta to further improve urban mobility problems. The imbalance between public infrastructures provided by the number of people who need it led to a lack of municipal services. Transportation Online has become one transportation solutions, present in transportation needs cheap, efficient, and fast. Even amid the busy road, using motor transportation would be faster. This study aims to develop a model that connects between the independent variables namely; Online Marketing (X1), Brand Awareness (X2) with the dependent variable is the Decision of Repurchase (Y2) and Customer Satisfaction (Y1). This research was conducted in East Jakarta. The research method used was surveyed. The population in this study is the user Transportation Online East Jakarta area. The sampling technique used in this study is incidental sampling. These results indicate that the two independent variables, namely Marketing Online (X1) and Brand Awareness (X2) effect on Repurchase Decision variable (Y2) and Customer Satisfaction (Y1). From the test results simultaneously obtained that Online Marketing and Brand Awareness jointly influence decisions repurchase mediated by customer satisfaction Transportation Online service users, means the better online marketing and brand awareness of the company, the higher the repurchase decisions and customer satisfaction. © The Authors, published by EDP Sciences, 2019.

Authors: Fahlevi M., Saparudin M., Maemunah S., Irma D., Ekhsan M.
Title: Cybercrime Business Digital in Indonesia
Affiliations: Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Kusuma Negara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Pelita Bangsa, Cikarang, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Fahlevi, M., Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Kusuma Negara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Saparudin, M., Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Kusuma Negara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Maemunah, S., Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Kusuma Negara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Irma, D., Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Kusuma Negara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ekhsan, M., Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Pelita Bangsa, Cikarang, Indonesia
Abstract: The development of information technology and especially internet communication has caused significant social, economic and cultural changes to occur so quickly. On one side of information technology can provide benefits, simplify and accelerate access to information that we need in all things and can change the model of the economy and business models. However, even a negative impact cannot be avoided. Along with the development of internet technology, causing the emergence of new crimes called new cybercrime through the internet network. In this study, the authors approached qualitatively with interview methods and supported descriptive data from research sources originating from regulators and current digital business people who aimed to find out cybercrime in Indonesia. The results of this study, both regulators and business people view that critical preventive measures are taken and the law must continue to follow the development of crime in the cyber world. © The Authors, published by EDP Sciences, 2019.
Author Keywords: Business; Cybercrime; Digital; Fraud; Law
Index Keywords: Crime; Industry; Information systems; Information use; Cultural changes; Cybercrime; Digital; Digital business; Fraud; Internet communication; Internet technology; Preventive measures; Computer crime

Authors: Simpen I.N., Abdi M.N., Fahlevi M., Noviantoro R., Muhtar
Title: The Effect of Socialization, Sanction, and E-Filing on Annual SPT Reporting
Affiliations: Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Kusuma Negara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Department of Finance, Faculty of Economics, University of Muhammadiyah, Makassar, Indonesia; Department of Accounting, Faculty of Economics, University of Dehasen, Bengkulu, Indonesia; Department of Finance, Faculty of Economics, University of Bosowa, Makassar, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Simpen, I.N., Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Kusuma Negara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Abdi, M.N., Department of Finance, Faculty of Economics, University of Muhammadiyah, Makassar, Indonesia; Fahlevi, M., Department of Management, Faculty of Economics, School of Business Kusuma Negara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Noviantoro, R., Department of Accounting, Faculty of Economics, University of Dehasen, Bengkulu, Indonesia; Muhtar, Department of Finance, Faculty of Economics, University of Bosowa, Makassar, Indonesia
Abstract: Understanding to fill the tax return, annual report tax return individual is still lacking, many taxpayers did not understand how to fill out an annual tax return, especially the tax year 2014. The objective was to investigate the influence of socialization Tax, Tax Penalties and Tax e-filing of the tax return reporting annual individual taxpayer. Sampling was done by purposive sampling method and selection of non-random manner convenience. The primary data collection method used is survey method using a questionnaire. Data were analyzed using multiple linear analysis, descriptive analysis and to test hypotheses. © The Authors, published by EDP Sciences, 2019.
